message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM 

The paper deals with the problem of estimating reflectance maps of specular materials from images, which is a core problem in computer vision and graphics. The proposed method uses a convolutional neural network architecture and end-to-end learning formulation, which are common techniques in computer vision and machine learning (cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI). The paper also proposes a new challenge of Specular MAterials on SHapes with complex IllumiNation (SMASHINg), which involves both synthetic and real images, indicating a focus on graphics and computer vision (cs.GR). Finally, the paper shows the application of the proposed method to a range of image-based editing tasks, which is a common application of computer vision and multimedia (cs.MM).
